Description: This registry defines the events for the management processor.

AdapterConfigurationChange.Description: The specified adapter has had a configuration change.
AdapterConfigurationChange.Message: The adapter in slot %1 has had a configuration change.

AggregateHealthStatusChange.Description: There has been a change in one or more subsytems aggregate health statuses.
AggregateHealthStatusChange.Message: AggregateServerHealth is %1, BiosOrHardwareHealth is %2, FanRedundancy is %3, Fans status is %4, LiquidCoolingRedundancy is %5, LiquidCooling status is %6, Memory status is %7, Network status is %8, PowerSupplies status is %9, PowerSuppliesMismatch state is %10, PowerSupplyRedundancy is %11, Processors status is %12, SmartStorageBattery status is %13, Storage status is %14 and Temperatures status is %15.

AutoShutdownCancelled.Description: Management processor cancelled previously initiated automatic operating system shutdown.
AutoShutdownCancelled.Message: Management processor cancelled previously initiated automatic operating system shutdown. Cause: %1.
AutoShutdownCancelled.Resolution: Check shutdown cause and the Integrated Management Log (IML) for additional information.

AutoShutdownInitiated.Description: Management processor initiated an automatic operating system shutdown.
AutoShutdownInitiated.Message: Management processor initiated an automatic operating system shutdown. Cause: %1.
AutoShutdownInitiated.Resolution: Check shutdown cause and the Integrated Management Log (IML) for additional information.

BIOSSafeModeEngaged.Description: BIOS Safe Mode is engaged. System will boot in a minimal configuration.
BIOSSafeModeEngaged.Message: BIOS Safe Mode is engaged. System will boot in a minimal configuration.

BIOSSafeModeExit.Description: BIOS Safe Mode has successfully booted. System will resume boot in a minimal configuration.
BIOSSafeModeExit.Message: BIOS Safe Mode has successfully booted. System will resume boot in a minimal configuration.

ComputeOpsManagerConnected.Description: HPE Compute Ops Manager connection status is changed to Connected.
ComputeOpsManagerConnected.Message: HPE Compute Ops Manager connection status is Connected.

ComputeOpsManagerConnectionFailed.Description: HPE Compute Ops Manager connection status is changed to Failed.
ComputeOpsManagerConnectionFailed.Message: HPE Compute Ops Manager connection is failed.

ComputeOpsManagerConnectionInProgress.Description: HPE Compute Ops Manager connection status is changed to In Progress.
ComputeOpsManagerConnectionInProgress.Message: HPE Compute Ops Manager connection is in progress.

ComputeOpsManagerConnectionInitiated.Description: Connection to HPE Compute Ops Manager has been initiated.
ComputeOpsManagerConnectionInitiated.Message: Connection to HPE Compute Ops Manager has been initiated by: %1.

ComputeOpsManagerConnectionNotEnabled.Description: HPE Compute Ops Manager connection status is changed to Not Enabled.
ComputeOpsManagerConnectionNotEnabled.Message: HPE Compute Ops Manager is not Enabled.

ComputeOpsManagerDisabledByFactoryDefaul.Description: Connection to HPE Compute Ops Manager has been disabled due to Factory defaults.
ComputeOpsManagerDisabledByFactoryDefaul.Message: Connection to HPE Compute Ops Manager has been disabled due to Factory defaults.

ComputeOpsManagerDisabledBySecureErase.Description: Connection to HPE Compute Ops Manager has been disabled due to secure erase.
ComputeOpsManagerDisabledBySecureErase.Message: Connection to HPE Compute Ops Manager has been disabled due to secure erase by user %1.

ComputeOpsManagerDisabledByUser.Description: User has disabled connection to HPE Compute Ops Manager.
ComputeOpsManagerDisabledByUser.Message: Connection to HPE Compute Ops Manager has been disabled by User %1.

DeviceDiscoveryStatusV2.Description: The server device discovery status has changed.
DeviceDiscoveryStatusV2.Message: Discovery status is now: AMS: %1, Device Discovery: %2, Smart Array Storage: %3

DriveInserted2.Description: The ATA drive has been inserted into the specified location.
DriveInserted2.Message: The ATA drive has been inserted in location %1 connected to controller in %2.

DriveRemoved2.Description: The ATA drive has been removed from the specified location.
DriveRemoved2.Message: The ATA drive has been removed from location %1 connected to controller in %2.

DrvArrLogDrvErasing.Description: The logical drive is currently being erased.
DrvArrLogDrvErasing.Message: The drive array logical drive %1 on controller located in %2 is currently being erased.

DrvArrLogDrvExpanding.Description: The logical drive is currently undergoing a transformation.
DrvArrLogDrvExpanding.Message: The drive array logical drive %1 on controller located in %2 is currently undergoing a transformation.

DrvArrLogDrvNewLogDrvKeyRekeyRequestRece.Description: The logical drive is currently encrypted and has received a request to rekey all data with a new logical drive encryption key.The logical drive is online.
DrvArrLogDrvNewLogDrvKeyRekeyRequestRece.Message: The drive array logical drive %1 on controller located in %2 is currently encrypted and has received a request to rekey all data with a new logical drive encryption key.

DrvArrLogDrvPredictiveSpareRebuildReady.Description: The logical drive is ready to perform a predictive spare rebuild.
DrvArrLogDrvPredictiveSpareRebuildReady.Message: The drive array logical drive %1 on controller located in %2 is ready to perform a predictive spare rebuild.

DrvArrLogDrvQueuedForExpansion.Description: The logical drive is ready for transformation.
DrvArrLogDrvQueuedForExpansion.Message: The drive array logical drive %1 on controller located in %2 is ready for transformation.

DrvArrLogDrvRapidParityInitializationInP.Description: The logical drive is currently undergoing rapid parity initialization.
DrvArrLogDrvRapidParityInitializationInP.Message: The drive array logical drive %1 on controller located in %2 is currently undergoing rapid parity initialization.

DrvArrLogDrvRapidParityInitializationPen.Description: The logical drive is currently pending rapid parity initialization and will be unavailable.
DrvArrLogDrvRapidParityInitializationPen.Message: The drive array logical drive %1 on controller located in %2 is currently pending rapid parity initialization and will be unavailable.

DrvArrLogDrvReadyRebuild.Description: The drive array logical drive is ready for Automatic Data Recovery.
DrvArrLogDrvReadyRebuild.Message: The drive array logical drive %1 on controller located in %2 is ready for Automatic Data Recovery.
DrvArrLogDrvReadyRebuild.Resolution: The failed physical drive has been replaced, but the logical drive is still operating in Interim Recovery Mode.

DrvArrLogDrvRebuilding.Description: The drive array logical drive is currently doing Automatic Data Recovery.
DrvArrLogDrvRebuilding.Message: The drive array logical drive %1 on controller located in %2 is currently doing Automatic Data Recovery.

DrvArrLogDrvRekeyInProgress.Description: The logical drive is currently encrypted and all data is currently being rekeyed with a new logical drive key using the background capacity expansion transformation task.
DrvArrLogDrvRekeyInProgress.Message: The drive array logical drive %1 on controller located in %2 is currently encrypted and all data is currently being rekeyed with a new logical drive key using the background capacity expansion transformation task.

DrvArrLogDrvUnconfigured.Description: The drive array logical drive is not configured.
DrvArrLogDrvUnconfigured.Message: The drive array logical drive %1 on controller located in %2 is not configured.

DrvArrLogDrvUnencryptedToEncryptedTransf.Description: The logical drive is currently being transformed from unencrypted to encrypted and the volume is online.
DrvArrLogDrvUnencryptedToEncryptedTransf.Message: The drive array logical drive %1 on controller located in %2 is currently being transformed from unencrypted to encrypted and the volume is online.

DrvArrLogDrvUnencryptedToEncryptedTransf.Description: The logical drive has received a request to transform from unencrypted to encrypted but this process has not yet started.The unencrypted logical drive is currently online.
DrvArrLogDrvUnencryptedToEncryptedTransf.Message: The drive array logical drive %1 on controller located in %2 has received a request to transform from unencrypted to encrypted but this process has not yet started.

DrvArrPhysDrvEraseDone.Description: The drive array physical drive has been erased and is is now in an offline state.
DrvArrPhysDrvEraseDone.Message: The drive array physical drive at location %1 connected to controller in %2 has been erased and is now in an offline state.

DrvArrPhysDrvEraseQueued.Description: An erase operation is currently queued for the drive array physical drive.
DrvArrPhysDrvEraseQueued.Message: An erase operation is currently queued for the drive array physical drive at location %1 connected to controller in %2.

DrvArrPhysDrvErasing.Description: The drive array physical drive is being erased.
DrvArrPhysDrvErasing.Message: The drive array physical drive at location %1 connected to controller in %2 is being erased.

DrvArrSpareDriveActive.Message: Drive array spare drive at location %1 connected to controller in %2 has completed Automatic Data Recovery.

DrvArrSpareDriveBuilding.Description: A physical drive has failed. Automatic Data Recovery is in progress to recover data to the on-line spare.
DrvArrSpareDriveBuilding.Message: Drive array spare drive at location %1 connected to controller in %2 has Automatic Data Recovery in progress.

DrvArrSpareDriveInactive.Description: An on-line spare is configured, but is not currently in use.
DrvArrSpareDriveInactive.Message: Drive array spare drive at location %1 connected to controller in %2 is configured, but is not currently in use.

DrvArrayAccBoardTempDisabled_ExpandInPro.Description: Write cache operations have been temporarily disabled due to an expand of a logical drive.
DrvArrayAccBoardTempDisabled_ExpandInPro.Message: Write cache operations for cache module board located in %1 have been temporarily disabled due to an expand of a logical drive.

DrvArrayAccBoardTempDisabled_SnapshotInP.Description: Write cache operations have been temporarily disabled due to a snapshot operation that is queued up or in progress.
DrvArrayAccBoardTempDisabled_SnapshotInP.Message: Write cache operations for cache module board located in %1 have been temporarily disabled due to a snapshot operation that is queued up or in progress.

FanInserted.Description: A fault tolerant fan has been inserted into the specified fan location.
FanInserted.Message: The fan has been inserted in fan location %1.

FanRemoved.Description: A fault tolerant fan has been removed from the specified fan location.
FanRemoved.Message: The fan has been removed from fan location %1.

FirmwareFlashStatusChanged.Description: The firmware flash status has changed
FirmwareFlashStatusChanged.Message: The firmware flash status is now %1

FirmwareIntegrityScanComplete.Description: This event is generated when a firmware integrity issue is found during firmware scan irrespective of a recovery success or failure.
FirmwareIntegrityScanComplete.Message: Management Processor completed the firmware integrity scan and detected an anomaly.

FirmwareRecoveryRequest.Description: This event is generated when firmware recovery is requested.

IntelligentDiagnosticsEnabled.Description: Intelligent Diagnostics Enabled: Server will attempt automated recovery.
IntelligentDiagnosticsEnabled.Message: Intelligent Diagnostics Enabled: Server will attempt automated recovery.

IntelligentDiagnosticsExit.Description: Intelligent Diagnostics Exit: Automated server recovery has concluded.
IntelligentDiagnosticsExit.Message: Intelligent Diagnostics Exit: Automated server recovery has concluded.

IntrusionHWInstalled.Description: System intrusion alert hardware is installed.

IntrusionHWRemoved.Description: System intrusion alert hardware is removed.
IntrusionHWRemoved.Resolution: There is no action required if the removal of the hardware is expected.  If the hardware was not intentionally removed, please verify cable connection.

MirroredMemoryEngaged.Description: Advanced Memory Protection Mirrored Memory Engaged. The Advanced Memory Protection subsystem has detected a memory fault. Mirrored Memory has been activated.
MirroredMemoryEngaged.Message: The Advanced Memory Protection subsystem has engaged the online spare memory.

PowerSupplyInserted.Description: A fault tolerant power supply has been inserted into the specified bay location.
PowerSupplyInserted.Message: A power supply has been inserted in bay %1.

PowerSupplyRemoved.Description: A fault tolerant power supply has been removed from the specified bay location.
PowerSupplyRemoved.Message: A power supply has been removed from bay %1.

RemoteSupportRegistrationComplete.Description: The server was registered to Remote Support.
RemoteSupportRegistrationComplete.Message: The server was registered to Remote Support using the %1 method

RemoteSupportUnregistrationComplete.Description: The server was unregistered from Remote Support.
RemoteSupportUnregistrationComplete.Message: The server was unregistered from Remote Support.

ServerPostComplete.Description: The server has reached Power On Self Test complete.
ServerPostComplete.Message: The server has reached Power On Self Test complete

ServerPostDiscoveryComplete.Description: The server has completed device discovery.
ServerPostDiscoveryComplete.Message: The server has completed device discovery.

ServerPoweredOff.Description: The server has been powered off.
ServerPoweredOff.Message: The server has been powered off.

ServerPoweredOn.Description: The server has been powered on.
ServerPoweredOn.Message: The server has been powered on.

ServerResetDetected.Description: Server Reset Detected. Management Processor firmware has detected a server reset.
ServerResetDetected.Resolution: Refer to the Integrated Management Log for details on the cause of the server reset.

iLODriveComponentAdded.Description: A component was added to the iLO Drive.
iLODriveComponentAdded.Message: The component "%1" was added to the iLO Drive

Name: Resource Event Registry
